data.title: Museums in Ohio
data.meta_description: Ohio Museum Map providing the exact locations of the Museums in Ohio, USA. This map is a good source for travel the Museums In Ohio.
data.text:
1.4K

The towns like Cincinnati, Mansfield, Dayton, Oxford, Kenton, Massillion, Marietta, Lancaster and others house the well-known museums of Ohio. Locational details of the cities where the museums are situated can be found in the Ohio Museums Map.

William Howard Traft National Historic Site located in Cincinnati is known to be the place where the 27th president of USA was born. Dunbar House in Dayton is an important house museum of Ohio where the famous poet Paul Laurence Dunbar spent the last days of his life. Lane-Hooven House located in Hamilton town of Ohio, which was constructed in 1863 in an octagonal shape, showcases period furnishings, stained glass gate, woodwork of ash and butternut and a unique spiral staircase. Mansion View, another interesting museum of Ohio situated in Toledo, is a Victorian edifice and carriage house which is taken care of by the Old West End Association. The Thurber House in the capital of Ohio Columbus is the restored dwelling place of James Thurber who was famous as a cartoonist, author, playwright and humorist. Miami university Art museum, Springfield Museum of Art and Kennedy Museum of Art are some other most-visited museums of Ohio. The location of museums can also be found in the Ohio state map.

In 1907 the interurban railways had 2,809.22 miles of railways in Ohio. According to a survey taken in 2000, Ohio has a total of 4,525.45 miles of train tracks serviced by Class I railroads. Norfolk Southern and CSXT are the major railway service providers of Ohio. While CSXT operates over 3233 miles of tracks in the state, Norfolk Southern functions over a total of 21, 800 miles. The wide reaching network of railways passing through various towns of the state are clearly marked in our Ohio Railway Map. Major towns like Canton, Cleveland, Akron, Dayton, Toledo, Huntington and several others are indicated in the railway map of Ohio. Apart from the state railroads, Ohio is also rich in regional railway organizations such as Wheeling & Lake Erie, Indiana & Ohio, Bessemer & Lake Erie, Ohio Central, Amtrak-Lake Shore Line, Three Rivers, Cardinal and Capitol Limited. These companies offer passenger lines. Railway routes linking nearby and distant areas of the state can be found in the Ohio state map as well.
